rea.model package

Submodules

rea.model.model module

class rea.model.model.Model(output_path: str, data_path: str, nwtype: str, hidden_layer_units: List[int], hidden_layer_activations: List[str], conv_layer_kernels: Optional[List[List[int]]] = None, batch_size: int = 10, epochs: int = 100, use_class_weights: bool = False, val_split: float = 0.1, dropout: float = 0.5, learning_rate: float = 0.001, use_decay: bool = False, seed: int = 42)[source]

Bases: rea.processing_module.ProcessingModule

Module for creating and training feed forward and convolutional neural networks.

__init__(output_path: str, data_path: str, nwtype: str, hidden_layer_units: List[int], hidden_layer_activations: List[str], conv_layer_kernels: Optional[List[List[int]]] = None, batch_size: int = 10, epochs: int = 100, use_class_weights: bool = False, val_split: float = 0.1, dropout: float = 0.5, learning_rate: float = 0.001, use_decay: bool = False, seed: int = 42)[source]

Train an artificial neural network model for a fixed number of epochs.

Parameters

  • output_path – path where to save the model

  • data_path – path to the Data output folder

  • nwtype – The type of network to use (“ff” or “conv”)

  • hidden_layer_units – the number of units for each hidden layer

  • batch_size – number of samples per gradient update

  • epochs – number of epochs to train the model

  • use_class_weights – flag that enables or disables precomputed class_weights :param dropout: Rate for keras Dropout layer

  • learning_rate – Learning rate for adam optimizer or initial learning rate for exponential decay

  • use_decay – Use adam with exponential decay

  • seed – random seed for numpy and tensorflow

_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>
static compile_model(model: keras.engine.training.Model, learning_rate: float = 0.001, learning_decay: bool = False) → keras.engine.training.Model[source]

Configures the model for training

Parameters

  • model – The tensorflow model to compile

  • learning_rate – Learning rate for adam optimizer or initial learning rate for exponential decay

  • learning_decay – Use adam with exponential decay

Returns

compiled model

static create_conv_model(input_shape: Union[List[int], Tuple[int]], output_units: int, convolutions: List[int], hidden_layer_activations: List[str], conv_layer_kernels: List[List[int]], dropout: float = 0.5, learning_rate: float = 0.001, use_decay: bool = False) → keras.engine.training.Model[source]

Create a convolutional network with the specified convolutions and input shape.

Parameters

  • input_shape – The shape of the input

  • output_units – The number of output units (e.g. classes)

  • convolutions – The number of convolutions for each hidden layer

  • hidden_layer_activations – Activation functions for each hidden layer

  • conv_layer_kernels – Kernel-size for each convolutional layer

  • dropout – Rate for keras Dropout layer

  • learning_rate – Learning rate for adam optimizer or initial learning rate for exponential decay

  • use_decay – Use adam with exponential decay

Returns

A keras Model with a convolutional structure.

static create_ff_model(input_shape: Union[List[int], Tuple[int]], output_units: int, units_per_layer: List[int], hidden_layer_activations: List[str], dropout: float = 0.5, learning_rate: float = 0.001, use_decay: bool = False) → keras.engine.training.Model[source]

Create a feed-forward style neural network with the specified number of hidden layers and activations.

Parameters

  • input_shape – the shape of the input data

  • output_units – the number of output units (e.g. classes)

  • units_per_layer – number of hidden units for each hidden layer

  • hidden_layer_activations – name of activation function for each hidden layer

  • dropout – Rate for keras Dropout layer

  • learning_rate – Learning rate for adam optimizer or initial learning rate for exponential decay

  • use_decay – Use adam with exponential decay

Returns

A keras Model with a feed-forward structure.

data: Optional[Data]
run(data: Optional[rea.data.data.Data] = None) → None[source]

Execute the primary module function.

Parameters

data – (Optional) Can be provided when using the API mode.

setup_data(data: Optional[rea.data.data.Data] = None) → None

Sets the data attribute to data. If None is provided a Data instance is created with Data.read.

Parameters

data – Instance to use or None.
